talk0128:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Link! I'm pleased as a pickled pike to see
you again!<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0700>Uh...<sp:5:1:0> Pardon me. I was so happy to see
your face that I let loose with an old
hometown saying.
I'm from a little <clr:0000>fishing village <clr:ffff>in the
<clr:0000>southeast of Hyrule<clr:ffff>, if you didn't know.

It's been a while since I left, but you know
what they say. You can take the boy out
of Lurelin...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:LaughS>It's a small village, but the culture and
food are like none other. People travel
far and wide for the atmosphere.
If you're ever in the area, you should
pay a visit!
talk0041:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>That whole story about Princess Zelda
had me reeling, so I never introduced
myself properly.<sp:0:4:0>Sorry about that. Once again, my name
is <clr:0000>Tauro<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:4:0>I'm here on Paya's request to investigate
the ruins that fell around this village.
talk0129:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Are you interested in the lab?


You're not going to find much of interest
in the research documents there unless
you're into that kind of thing.
However, if you're interested in anything
Zonai related, poke around some of the
other researchers' tents.
Some are knowledgeable about the
<clr:0000>sky islands <clr:ffff>and <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff>. That might
appeal to you more.
talk0101:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>I'm sorry, Tauro. You're not the right
one for the job.
talk0130:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I think the only one who likes visiting
this kind of place is the village chief.

She's just as passionate about her
research as we are.

And she's taken to deciphering Zonai
script like a fish to water!

She's so good, in fact, it feels like a waste
to stick her on chief duties.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>But I'm getting off track. You're interested
in Zonai stuff, yeah?

The documents here might be too high-
level for you, but the other researchers
love to chat about their work. Just ask!
talk0131:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Uh, someone else is here for the job?
Already?

<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0a00>I guess it's a lost cause.


Everyone seems kind of busy.


I'll head back to <clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff> and...just stare up
at those <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>. May as well head out before
I get in anyone's way.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0044:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Thanks for helping with Wortsworth's
research!<sp:0:4:0>I can't say I understand ancient Hyrulean
at all. <sp:5:1:0>But I know the joy that comes from
brushing up against an unknown world.<sp:0:4:0>So I can imagine how excited Wortsworth
must be.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800>I'm right there with him!<sp:0:4:0>Hey, Wortsworth gave you some <clr:0000>Zonai
Survey Team fabric<clr:ffff>, right?<sp:0:4:0>There's a shop at <clr:0000>Hateno Village <clr:ffff>that
makes interesting stuff from bits of fabric
like that.<sp:0:4:0>You're a bona fide member of the Zonai
Survey Team now, Link.<sp:0:4:0>When you use that fabric, it'll show that
you're one of us!
talk0103:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>Uh, someone else is here for the job?
Already?

<sp:0:2:2:5000><sp:3:0:2:0a00>*sigh* I guess it's a lost cause.


I'll head back to <clr:0000>Kakariko Village <clr:ffff>and...just stare up
at those <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>.<sp:0:2:2:6400>
talk0045:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseM>The hero?<sp:5:0:0> The ANCIENT hero?!


...


Oh, wait. You're Link. For a moment,
I thought the ancient hero had been
resurrected!
<sp:3:0:2:0800>That is quite the getup. I'd love to try
it on, myself.
talk0104:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Angry_01>C'mon, don't say that! You've got to let
me cast my line into the Depths too.

I'm capable of deciphering some <clr:0000>Zonai
script<clr:ffff>—who else can tackle that stuff?
talk0133:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Thank you!


I'm sure everyone will feel better knowing
you're on the case.

Y'know... I'm curious about what I heard
about Hyrule Castle too. Doc is chasing
that, so I think it'll be OK.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Besides, my discovery might hold a clue
about finding Princess Zelda.

<sp:3:0:2:0801>Well, I'll explain everything to you.
This way!
talk0046:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:QuestionNormal>Anyway, you appear to be the bold type,
judging by your...outfit.
talk0105:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_00>I mean, your skills would be super helpful
to me... You're the one in charge of the
Zonai Survey Team, after all.
But aren't you heading up the <clr:0000>Ring
Ruins<clr:ffff> investigation in <clr:0000>Kakariko Village<clr:ffff>,
anyway, Tauro?
That's where your focus should be. Those
fallen ruins are huge and exciting! Big
enough to <clr:0000>see from<clr:ffff> <clr:0000>Lookout Landing<clr:ffff>!
So, please, finish your work there before
asking to join in new research.
talk0134:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_01>Are you <sp:5:0:0>curious about the figure that was
sighted at Hyrule Castle or something?

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Doc is looking into that, so she's got
it handled.

<sp:3:0:2:0800>Besides, my discovery might hold a clue
about finding Princess Zelda.

I'll explain more. This way—come, come!
talk0047:
<sp:3:0:2:0801>Trust me, I understand. If I could run
around in nothing but my unmentionables,
I just might.
But there's a certain amount of decorum
required in my field. Especially when Paya
is around.
Otherwise, I wouldn't bother so much with
clothing. Better to feel the breeze on my
skin while I work!
<sp:3:0:2:0800>It warms my heart to see I've found a
kindred spirit in you, Link.
talk0106:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad>But!<sp:5:0:0>


<sp:3:0:2:0c01>But to read firsthand Zonai history...<sp:5:1:0>
That bait's too juicy to pass up!
talk0048:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Investigating the floating Ring Ruin was
the single biggest discovery in my career.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800>Due in part to you, Link.<sp:0:4:0>Our ancestors left behind such a rich
history. <sp:5:1:0>It's crucial that we pass that
knowledge on to future generations.<sp:0:4:0>But any history needs to be accurate. So
I intend to continue my work translating
Zonai inscriptions!<sp:0:4:0>Thank you for all your contributions.
talk0107:
<clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0a00>Tauro <clr:ffff>is an amazing person. And he's a
first-rate archaeologist too!

But he loves Zonai research so much
that he'll bolt from a project to chase
any new discoveries.
talk0108:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice>Oh, Swordsman, did you perhaps come to
help with our <clr:0000>investigation of the Depths<clr:ffff>?
talk0137:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>What's up?


I can't stop thinking about the floating
<clr:0000>Ring Ruin<clr:ffff>...
talk0109:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice>I've been looking for someone to help
with my <clr:0000>investigation of the Depths<clr:ffff>.

I mean, you'd be best for the job...
talk0138:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Paya is working away studying Zonai
scripts and researching old documents.

If she's working that hard, then I should
be too.

Her talents are wasted stuck here
as chief.
talk0110:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Thank you!


Having you help out is such a relief.


We'll explain all the details to you. Come
with me!
talk0139:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Link, have you been feeling the urge to
learn more about the ruins?

I'd encourage you to explore the Ring
Ruins that fell around the village. Nothing
like hands-on study!
A <clr:0000>translation of the text<clr:ffff> has been placed
near each of the slabs inside.

If you're curious, it's all there to be read.
talk0111:
<sp:3:0:2:0800>Aw, c'mon! At least let me tell you some
of the details!

See, I made an amazing discovery. Come
here—I wanna show you!
talk0140:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Even though we've deciphered the stone
slabs, we have to continue investigating
the Ring Ruins.<sp:0:4:0>The most minute detail could actually
be meaningful.<sp:0:4:0>Or something in the debris could have a
medicinal purpose. There's always
the potential for new discoveries.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>This is why it's crucial for us to continue
our research.
talk0112:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I don't plan on disobeying Princess
Zelda's orders, but it's not easy to abide
by them, and I'll tell you why.
Each of the other <clr:0000>four Ring Ruins <clr:ffff>we're
allowed to enter has a stone slab with
Zonai writing on it.
They're precious artifacts, with records
from an ancient people about purported
sages.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>There's got to be a fifth slab in that
floating Ring Ruin with even more
information on the sage.
I'm beside myself imagining all the details
we might be missing out on!
talk0114:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You're not going to find much of interest
in the research documents here unless
you're into that kind of thing.
However, if you're interested in anything
Zonai related, poke around some of the
other researchers' tents.
Some are knowledgeable about the
<clr:0000>sky islands <clr:ffff>and <clr:0000>gloom<clr:ffff>. That might
appeal to you more.
talk0143:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS>Thanks to your contributions, Link,
we've learned new things about the
age of legends.<sp:0:4:0>Wortsworth told me all about how much
you've helped him. He's been worked up
with excitement for a while now.<sp:0:4:0>And thanks to you, I got a look at some
important ruins and records myself.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0800>There's plenty of excitement to
go around!
talk0115:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I think the only one who likes visiting
this kind of place is the village chief.

She's just as passionate about her
research as we are.

And she's taken to deciphering Zonai
script like a fish to water!

She's so good, in fact, it feels like a waste
to stick her on chief duties.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>But I'm getting off track. You're interested
in Zonai stuff, yeah?

The documents here might be too high-
level for you, but the other researchers
love to chat about their work. Just ask!
talk0116:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Have you been to all <clr:0000>four <clr:ffff>of the <clr:0000>Ring
Ruins<clr:ffff> that fell around the village yet?<sp:0:4:0>Most of them broke apart when they
landed. We found a <clr:0000>stone slab with
some writing <clr:ffff>inside each of the sites.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>I deciphered the inscriptions and found
out they'd been written by those the
ancients knew as <clr:0000>sages<clr:ffff>.
My guess is that the floating Ring Ruin
also has a stone slab with even more
details about these <clr:0000>sages<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0a00>But Princess Zelda has put her foot down
and forbidden anyone from going inside,
so there's no way to know.
talk0117:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Princess Zelda ordered everyone to stay
out of the floating Ring Ruins. It's a hard
thing to ask of us, but she's the princess.
Nothing to do in the meantime but keep
investigating the other ruins.

<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Have you been to them yet? There's <clr:0000>four<clr:ffff>
other <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff> around the village.

Most of them broke apart on impact.
Inside each site, we found an intriguing
stone slab.
<sp:3:0:2:0800>If you ask me, these slabs will be the
key unlocking the mysteries of the
Zonai civilization!
talk0118:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I knew there'd be something big tucked
away in that floating Ring Ruin, but this
was bigger than I imagined.
The moment Paya set eyes on those
ruins, she called the Zonai Survey Team
right away.
It was the right call, but that's no
surprise. Every time I look at these
ruins, I'm in awe of her effectiveness.
The chief sure is something, isn't she?
talk0123:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>What's up?


I can't stop thinking about that floating
<clr:0000>Ring Ruin<clr:ffff>...
talk0124: <sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting>Hm? <sp:5:0:0>What are you doing out at this hour?
